{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3550634,"name":"Paul Rensing","username":"prensing","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/prensing/{size}/65820_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-07T19:40:24.189Z","cooked":"

Has anyone got WPICal to work? We are trying to use it to figure out the location of the Apriltags in our practice space, and the results are so far, umm, terrible.

I am using my cell phone to capture videos. I calibrated it with a CharUco 5x5 board (I have done similar for our robot cameras.) I have then tried 2 differenct sets of short videos of the tags in our space.

The most obvious problem is that the output of WPICal puts a large slope in Z on the Reef tags. So, the results say that tag 7 is ~10cm high, tag 8 was the reference, tag 9 is down by about 4cm and 10 down by 20cm.

I did go through and check the physical tags. They are at the right height (within ~1/8 inch) and level (according to a spirit level).

I don’t see any mention of diagnostic or debug output, so I am not sure what to try next. Any help would be appreciated.

What settings did you use for the camera calibration? What were the results of your camera calibration? Would you be able to post the calibration json?

Can I ask when WPICal is supposed to help? While it works great for generating a field for that event during the calibration time, after half the event, everything moves, carpet stretches, etc. There isn’t a time to recalibrate during the event (especially before playoffs to recalibrate), so when does it help?

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-03-08T01:31:50.637Z","reply_count":3,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":276,"readers_count":275,"score":85.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":494663,"topic_slug":"anyone-get-wpical-to-work","display_username":"Steven Carmain","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":1737,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programmer/Drive Coach"},"post_url":"/t/anyone-get-wpical-to-work/494663/3","custom_user_title":"Programmer/Drive Coach","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3550877,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-08T01:38:52.462Z","cooked":"
Steven_Carmain:

There isn’t a time to recalibrate during the event (especially before playoffs to recalibrate), so when does it help?

Ideally FTAs would allow teams to just walk around the field with a cell phone camera a few times during the event. I’m not sure I would recalibrate right before elims though, you’re risking a bad calibration messing up at a critical moment?

prensing:

The most obvious problem is that the output of WPICal puts a large slope in Z on the Reef tags.

We experienced similar results when we tried using WPICal earlier this season. We saw a fair deal of tag flipping in the video frame processing, which seemed to screw up results pretty badly. That + the way relationships between tag positions are determined made the results unusable from the amount of error present.

We got slightly better results from using very specific camera angles (to minimize tag ambiguity) and several short videos (instead of one long one), but still weren’t able to get error to an acceptable level.

I’ve tried many times to recalibrate the field while initializing the robot as a tech. It seems that no one has stopped me from doing that.

We’re on the same team.
In the awards ceremony at Halic, a quote from the Innovation in Control Award we (as CarbonPulse Robotics/10541) won was “they scanned the field like a ghost”. I’m not sure what exactly it’s referring to, but apparently there was an interesting coincidence with this thread lol.
It’s true that nobody stopped him from recalibrating the field though.

Why not just have the FTAs do this themselves at various points during the event and provide a public cal for everyone?
